newsitem.title: UK: Hanson up on Tarmac results, ADRs.
newsitem.headline: Hanson up on Tarmac results, ADRs.

text.p: Shares in Hanson Plc, the former conglomerate which recently spun off its non-building operations, extended recent gains on Wednesday as strong results from British building group Tarmac Plc raised hopes that Hanson will show similar profit growth, dealers said.
By 1027 GMT, Hanson shares were up 6-1/2p to 296-1/2, after their ADRs added $1-1/8 to $23-3/4 overnight.
Tarmac on Tuesday posted pre-tax profits of 75.5 million stg for 1997 and said its outlook for 1997 and beyond had improved.
"That's a good sign for Hanson," said one market maker of Tarmac's results.
Hanson shares have climbed 24p, or 8.8 percent, since April 3, when U.S. selling dried up, dealers said.
Earlier this week, the shares got a boost from a report in the Mail on Sunday newspaper that said the company was poised to sell non-core electrical activities.
